1e:T54b,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"FAQPage","mainEntity":[{"@type":"Question","name":"Do Spanish citizens need a visa for Argentina?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"No visa required for 90 days. Spanish citizens can enter with passport or DNI and apply for residency under bilateral agreements."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"What special benefits do Spanish citizens have?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Bilateral agreements provide simplified residency, social security reciprocity for pensioners, and recognition of Spanish professional qualifications."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"How big is the Spanish community?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Approximately 50,000-70,000 Spanish citizens in Argentina, with significant communities in Buenos Aires, Mendoza, and major cities."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Can I use my Spanish DNI in Argentina?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Yes, your Spanish DNI is valid for entry and can be used for some official processes, though a passport is recommended for initial entry."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Are Spanish qualifications recognized?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Generally yes, especially for university degrees and professional licenses, though some may require validation (homologaciÃ³n) depending on the
